title: Top 5 Tourist Attractions In Durban South Africa To Visit
text:
Home > Travel Destinations > Top 5 Tourist Attractions In Durban South Africa To Visit Top 5 Tourist Attractions In Durban South Africa To Visit   17, 2015 Pin It 
Durban ranks among the largest cities located in South Africa and it also boasts of a number of interesting tourist destinations. It has become one of the most attractive tourist spots in South Africa and is frequently visited by tourists from different countries. 
Durban is located along the coast and this is the reason why Durban beaches are one of the most interesting places to visit in this city. Not only beaches but the city also possesses a number of theatres, aquariums and various other interesting tourist places. Top Tourist Attractions in Durban South Africa 
Some of the most popular Tourist Attractions in Durban South Africa are as follows: Durban Beaches Photo Credits: puihlein 
Beaches serve as one of the major tourist destinations in Durban. Some of the most popular Durban beaches include Amanzimtoti, Ballito Beach and Umhlanga Beach. You will also find the Sardini Beach where the beauty of the sand, the sun and the sea serve as the main attractions. Golden Mile Photo Credits: dreaming_outdoors 
Golden Mile in Durban is a string of beautiful beaches protected from all kinds of shark attacks by the installation of nets and even by lifeguards patrolling the alert all throughout the day. Golden Mile serves to be one of the most popular tourist attractions in Durban South Africa with a wide stretch of sparkling sand. uShaka Marine World 
This is a theme park in Durban which is spread over 16 hectares and it consists of four separate sections. The sections of this theme park include uShaka Wet n Wild, uShaka Sea World, uShaka Village Walk and uShaka Beach. If you are on a holiday to Durban along with your kids then this place is a must-visit destination for you. Umgeni River Bird Park Photo Credits: Mandy Tregaskis 
Another wonderful place to visit in Durban is Umgeni River Bird Park. This is the bird zoo located on Umgeni River side in KwaZulu-Natal, Durban. This is a beautiful place covered with beautiful cliffs, and wonderful waterfalls. 
You can view many birds and many verities of species in this zoo. When visiting this zoo, you should not miss “Free Flight Bird Show”, which is the highlight for this zoo. Garden Route Photo Credits: elefant-tours.com 
Garden Route is also called the Eden of South Africa and it is an area which is rich in charm and natural beauty. Garden Route attracts outdoor enthusiasts and adventure seekers from throughout the world. It is a landscape featuring restorative beauty which is an amalgamation of ancient forests, wetlands, rivers, beaches, dunes, mountain scenery, fynbos and lakes.
